Pre-Game Insights: Germany finished top of Group A with seven points and are one of the most impressive performers in the group stage.
Germany have a balanced team with key players like Toni Kroos, Robert Andrich, Kai Havertz, Jamal Musiala, Florian Wirtz, and Ilkay Gundogan.
Denmark are a decent team but may struggle due to a lack of pace and front options, especially against Germany's strong defense.
Germany have home advantage and are expected to win by a two-goal margin.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match is held at Signal Iduna Park in Dortmund, Germany, on Saturday, June 29, 2024, at 3:00 PM ET.
The game can be watched on FOX.
